meanings.definition: The quality in a sound of being deep, full, and reverberating.
meanings.sent1: The resonances of the bell echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with the resonances of the singer's powerful voice.
meanings.sent3: The resonances of the drum made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: His words had the resonances of truth that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The resonances of the thunderstorm made the windows rattle.

meanings.definition: The reinforcement or prolongation of sound by reflection from a surface or by the synchronous vibration of a neighboring object.
meanings.sent1: The resonances of the music bounced off the walls of the empty room.
meanings.sent2: The resonances of the guitar strings filled the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The resonances of the laughter in the hallway made the teacher smile.
meanings.sent4: The resonances of the waves hitting the shore created a calming melody.
meanings.sent5: The resonances of the church bells could be heard across the town.

meanings.definition: A relationship of mutual understanding or trust and agreement between people.
meanings.sent1: Their friendship was built on resonances of shared experiences.
meanings.sent2: The resonances between the two leaders helped them work together effectively.
meanings.sent3: The resonances of their jokes always brought laughter to the group.
meanings.sent4: The resonances of their conversation flowed smoothly, showing their connection.
meanings.sent5: The resonances of their teamwork led to great success in the project.
